This Carthaginian general famously led war elephants across the Alps during the Second Punic War.
He unified China under a single imperial rule in the 3rd century BCE, standardizing weights, measures, and currency.
Known as the 'Iron King,' this French monarchâ€™s clashes with the papacy and the Knights Templar had far-reaching consequences in medieval Europe.
Renowned for commissioning the 'Domesday Book,' this Norman ruler secured his power in England after his victory at the Battle of Hastings in 1066.
Crowned Emperor of the Romans in 800 CE, he united much of Western Europe, ushering in a Carolingian Renaissance.
This Venetian merchant traveled the Silk Road to the court of Kublai Khan and later published a book that inspired explorers like Columbus.
What are the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World?
questions.answer: The Great Pyramid of Giza, Hanging Gardens of Babylon, Statue of Zeus at Olympia, Temple of Artemis at Ephesus, Mausoleum at Halicarnassus, Colossus of Rhodes, Lighthouse of Alexandria
